there are ways to help get the story out even if they ca or wo say the proper terminology well one thing to consider is that many of the cases that come to her do not necessarily arise because child victim has come forward to talk about it the abuse may be discovered in dealing with other trauma issues in the home family and often the child testimony turns out to be the only evidence of the abuse the case absolutely depends on what the prosecutors are able to get the child to say and as you say the cases don fail based solely on the child language they fail on the ability of the defense attorneys to sow doubt based on the child language it can often still be the language that makes the difference defense attorneys are extremely skilled at sowing doubt with the judge or jury in the child reliability as witness which adds to the childs extreme stress for example defense attorneys will try to refute pointing at pictures as coached or rehearsed response directed by the prosecuting legal team there is so much intense pressure on the child giving testimony so the more comfort they have with using the most accurate language the higher the chances are that prosecutors will be able to present clear and credible case the first time she told me about this my hardened and accomplished lawyer friend was crying over case they lost involving five year old girl who testimony description of the abuse was too vague to satisfy the legal standard and she specifically did not use words that accurately described the contact believe she said he touched my bottom when actually he penetrated her vagina that was all she could muster and then she shut down and the defense was able to sow the doubt that it was normal parental care of course they have many ways of approaching it and trying to get what they need but they don always work especially given the extreme pressure placed on the child in these situations and five year old witness can of course be bit of wild card it is much much easier to get the conviction if the child says inside my vagina or whatever the case may be so think we agree on the original point that it is extremely helpful to teach children the proper terminology in that first case she told me about the adult faced other repercussions for other charges but the legal team was extremely upset that they were unable to remove his ability to see the child it took another year or so of custody battles to resolve and alleviate the trauma the child was forced to relive in his presence at the time had young baby and my friend implored me to always teach her the most accurate words because this happens routinely and in the hundreds of cases she dealt with over the years have no doubt that there have been others ve always called my sons
